title: Does anyone actually know what determines LP gain/loss?
body:
Title ^

I have friends that get 30, lose 5 while I'm lucky to get 20 and lose 18 a match.

I hear it is your "MMR" match maker rating. Designed to help you climb faster if you deserve to be in a better tier. 

If your friend gains more than he loses, his MMR must be high so the game is helping him get out of his tier. 
With higher MMR though, your friend also has to play against higher ranked opponents. 

MMR increases by winning slowly over time.

See the thing is, we actually have the same MMR as I checked on op.gg

op.gg and all sites that look at MMR are just a rough estimate, however MMR is hidden and only Riot knows the real values.  That said, those sites aren't 100% accurate and shouldn't be taken to heart.  Even if it says you have the same as your friend, there is a very good chance they are actually different.

Back at the end of season 6 it told me I had Gold 1 MMR and I was only Gold 5, and had barely hit a 50% winrate... there was NO WAY on earth I had MMR that was anywhere near Gold 1.

Although I'm sure MMR has the biggest determining factor in the LP gain, I have to assume that there's more to it than that. Here's what I THINK determines LP gain (in the 09/18 patch):

Forenote: Not making this a KDA section because deaths factor more into the MMR than kills or assists. 

MMR: Factors between 30--55% of the LP gain/loss (if you've got a high MMR compared to your team, you'll lose less LP or gain more LP)
Objective Score (Drag, Herald, Baron, Towers, Inhib, Nexus): Factors about 20% of LP gain/loss

Deaths: Deaths per match factor between 10-15% of LP gain/loss
Kills: Kills per match factor between 5-10% of LP gain/loss.
Assists: Assists per match factor about 5% of LP gain/loss
CS: CS per match is determined by your role and lane (CS on ADC is more important than CS on Support, but generally has about a 5-10% factor on LP gain/loss

Vision Score: Vision score per match factors about 5% of LP gain/loss

This is by no means fact, I just find it hard to believe that MMR alone is the determining factor on LP gain/loss. Someone who does really well but loses because their team just sorta flopped shouldn't lose THAT much LP, although I guess if Riot wants to see who can carry low elo matches then it would make sense.

"A player's Elo rating is represented by a number which increases or decreases depending on the outcome of games between rated players. After every game, the winning player takes points from the losing one. The difference between the ratings of the winner and loser determines the total number of points gained or lost after a game. In a series of games between a high-rated player and a low-rated player, the high-rated player is expected to score more wins. If the high-rated player wins, then only a few rating points will be taken from the low-rated player. However, if the lower rated player scores an upset win, many rating points will be transferred. The lower rated player will also gain a few points from the higher rated player in the event of a draw. This means that this rating system is self-correcting. A player whose rating is too low should, in the long run, do better than the rating system predicts, and thus gain rating points until the rating reflects their true playing strength."
                                                                                                                                               - Wikipedia on Elo rating system

MMR/ELO isn't just a method in League. It is a commonly used system. It will average your teams MMR (hidden number, but many sites offer a somewhat accurate estimation) and the enemy teams MMR. If theirs is higher you win more, but your individual MMR does play a part.

In other games, if your team MMR is lower than your opponent team MMR then you gain more LP when you win because your match was harder.

I feel like at some point on a win streak, your MMR will be the highest on your team, so you are forced to carry (your high MMR balanced with lower MMR teammates).
